meanings.definition: To make or become tired or bored.
meanings.sent1: Walking for a long time wearies me.
meanings.sent2: Studying the same subject for hours wearies students.
meanings.sent3: The endless loop of the same song wearied the listeners.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous routine wearied her spirit.
meanings.sent5: The constant noise of the city wearied his mind.

meanings.definition: To cause to feel fatigue or boredom.
meanings.sent1: Her long speeches wearied the audience.
meanings.sent2: The repetitive tasks wearied the workers.
meanings.sent3: The never-ending meetings wearied the employees.
meanings.sent4: The tedious paperwork wearied his patience.
meanings.sent5: The dull movie wearied his interest.
